metadata.title: CVE-2022-32933 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An information disclosure issue was addressed by removing the vulnerablecode. This issue is fixed in macOS Monterey 12.5. A website may be able totrack the websites a user visited in Safari private browsing mode.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-32933` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.38.2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
wpewebkit package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
